channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024040205
item.description:
Report X-2024040205

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD PRODUCTS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER W2140A, GK FULFILLMENT CENTER, 199 SHEPARD AVE, WHEELING IL 60090-6021.

item.title: Report X-2024040199
item.description:
Report X-2024040199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE AIR DOCK BY THE AUDITOR TABLE. RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE AND BROUGHT SPILL CART AND DECISION TREE. ON INSPECTION, THE CARDBOARD WAS WET BUT THERE WAS NO PUDDLE FORMING. RESPONDER CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024040171
item.description:
Report E-2024040171

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal. HCE personnel repalletized the undamaged freight for shipping to its destination.

item.title: Report E-2024040125
item.description:
Report E-2024040125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 15, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel removed the damaged pails and overpacked them in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew utilized absorbent pads to further remove any paint and contained all spent absorbents in the same (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040098
item.description:
Report E-2024040098

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Klean Strip Denatured Alcohol released from one of the 1-gallon jugs in the box due to improper loading by NMP (a heavier piece of freight fell on it in transit). The release was absorbed by the cardboard box it was in. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The impacted box was containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum.

RESPONDER IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE, FOLLOWED THE PROPER PROCEDURES USING THE DECISION TREE, CONTAINED THE SPILL AND TRASPORTED THE SPILL TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024040105
item.description:
Report X-2024040105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE AND RESPONSE CART TO SOUTH PRIMARY SORT AISLE TO PICK UP REPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE. RECTANGULAR PACKAGE IS INTACT, DISCOLORED AND SLIGHTLY SOFT ON ONE END. NO SPILLAGE TO CLEAN UP. PUT THE PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TOTE AND PROMPTLY RETURNED IT TO THE PSC CAGE. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE FOUND LARGE 3" DIAMETER TABLETS LINING TWO SIDES OF THE BOX AND A PLASTIC BIN INSIDE. THE PLASTIC BIN HAS AN OXIDIZER 5.1 YELLOW DIAMOND LABEL PRINTED ON ONE SIDE. THE LID SEAL ON THE BIN IS INTACT AND SEALED. THE LOOSE TABLETS AND SOME SMALL WADS OF NEWSPAPER LINE 2 SIDES OF THE BOX. THERE ARE NO LABELS ON THE USED OUTER CARTON, EXCEPT A PIECE OF PAPER TAPED ON BEARING THE NUMBERS 525D-619-010. CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK AND SUBMITTED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT REPORT. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE ENTERED INTO ETT AND HELD FOR INSPECTION.

item.title: Report I-2024040003
item.description:
Report I-2024040003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 157-40574063 ORD/KTM Total 1 Pcs/ 153 Kgs Shipment booked as ELI for QR8116/20MAR2024 and arrived at Qatar Airways facility. However, Commodity in AWB indicated"Consolidation" without any lithium battery statement. Cargo piece is on hold at the Qatar Airways Cargo facility and advised Shipper of undeclared battery in AWB.
